channel.title: Programming
channel.description: This is the place for general UnrealScript and C++ coding questions and troubleshooting for everything from Unreal to Unreal Engine 4!

item.title: Question about bDeleteMe
item.author: invalid@example.com (EvilT-ModZ)
item.dc:creator: EvilT-ModZ
item.content:encoded:
Hello, could someone tell me, when we have to use bDeleteMe in conditions?
Is it only important only for iterators? Or bDeleteMe should be in all conditions where we check if Actor is valid or not?
Thanks in advance

item.title: Pre-Caching, how it works. Implementing custom precaching.
item.author: invalid@example.com (ROSoldier)
item.dc:creator: ROSoldier
item.content:encoded:
Hello all.

I have some basic Pre-Caching questions and I hope some of you might know the answers to them.

1) I know that precaching is used to Exclusively to "store" Resources in RAM memory, in order to decrease loading time.
Does that mean that Pre-Caching only reduces loading time, or It may also "speed up" the game during play?
EXAMPLE: Lets say we have two vehicles, or some other objects (doesn't really matter) that are going to spawn during play. Each vehicle has one texture (skin)....

Pre-Caching, how it works. Implementing custom precaching.

item.title: Make struct be referenced, not copied
item.author: invalid@example.com (eriaxy)
item.dc:creator: eriaxy
item.content:encoded: Sorry, i found out the answer.

item.title: I need an alternative to UPL files
item.author: invalid@example.com (ROSoldier)
item.dc:creator: ROSoldier
item.content:encoded:
Hello. In a game which has tens of character meshes, and hundreds of BodySkins and various face skins, the UPL system for specifying characters is not good to use at all.
I tried various alternatives but in the end everything was to no avail.

What I need is to be able to store all the information for all the characters the game has, in a Class,
similar to PlayerRecord, and then use this information to build various SetupRecords for the Pawns.
If someone has an alternative to the vanilla...

I need an alternative to UPL files

item.title: UnrealScript Non Static Func To Static
item.author: invalid@example.com (LightFusion)
item.dc:creator: LightFusion
item.content:encoded:
Hello, im stuck with this stuff - i want to make a non static native iterator function, to a static
Code:
native(310) final iterator function RadiusActors  ( class<actor> BaseClass, out actor Actor, float Radius, optional vector Loc );
Thats what i have !
Is it possible to convert it to static function like that
Code:
static function GetRadActor( Actor DummyActor,class<actor> BaseClass, out actor Actor, float Radius, optional vector Loc  )
{...
UnrealScript Non Static Func To Static

item.title: Code not working online?
item.author: invalid@example.com (ROSoldier)
item.dc:creator: ROSoldier
item.content:encoded:
Hello guys! I am working on something that is running fine in offline mode, but is buggy/not working properly on a Dedi server. I have no idea if its replication issues or something else.
If anyone is willing to help please drop me a PM and I will send you the code to take a look.

item.title: Dynamic (Per-map) server packages
item.author: invalid@example.com (ROSoldier)
item.dc:creator: ROSoldier
item.content:encoded:
Hello. I am working on a system that is supposed to add and remove ServerPackages in the *ini dynamically, on a per-map basis.
Meaning if some map is running couple of SPs must be added to the list, and all other uneeded must be removed removed,
and when another map is voted, the ones from the current map being removed, and the ones needed for the map to come to be added.
I am trying to do this in a custom gametype, since it will be easier I think.
What I currently have is:
in the...

Dynamic (Per-map) server packages

item.title: Linking IP to Guid
item.author: invalid@example.com (*mGm*Lizard)
item.dc:creator: *mGm*Lizard
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to link an IP to a Guid? Can I write a mutator to perform such a task? It would be a beneficial tool for admins to have at their disposal.

item.title: Shark Hunting Squid
item.author: invalid@example.com (Drunken_Peamole)
item.dc:creator: Drunken_Peamole
item.content:encoded: Does anyone know how to make a variant of "UnrealI.Squid" that only attacks "MyLevle.GhandiShark"s? Please help me with coding; or call it whatever you like and put it in whatever package you like; send it to me, or post it here, and I'll prominently mention your username, or whatever alias you like, in my new readme.txt file. Thanks.

item.title: Help with UT3 rocket launcher dual 6 shot
item.author: invalid@example.com (ZippyDSMlee)
item.dc:creator: ZippyDSMlee
item.content:encoded:
Yes the great bane to grammar nazis and competent coders everywhere has returned!

With UT4 on the horizon I wanted to start back on code nawing UT3 and zippyfing(zanny/lulzy) the weapons.


I can barely understand anything but I have managed to grasp a few operators and such even go the UT3 rocket launcher to load up 6-13 shots but I've hit a road block making it load up ammo on both fire modes.

I've found the code bits that control which fire mode gets to load up....

Help with UT3 rocket launcher dual 6 shot

item.title: How can be determined ip addresses within connection
item.author: invalid@example.com (LightFusion)
item.dc:creator: LightFusion
item.content:encoded:
Im working with game that run with custom server(its fully C++ mostly not unreal like server)
So i cant use native functins GetServerNetWorkaddress, simply it doesnt writing it there ! So i was wondering is there a way to determine ip address through connection, i was able to get my local address with ipdrv, but can it be used in this way ? In plus i can send some simple info on server, by special native functions, or recive a lot of info from server( by native functions).

Im loorking with...

How can be determined ip addresses within connection

item.title: "Remote" control vehicle
item.author: invalid@example.com (ROSoldier)
item.dc:creator: ROSoldier
item.content:encoded:
Hello guys. I would like to try to do something that may sound strange but actually must be possible in U Script.
What I am trying to do is a vehicle (lets say a ground vehicle) that can be remotely controlled by a specific player (players).
The idea is: A special weapon is given to the Player (a "remote") and he can use this remote to control the vehicle from distance without being inside. The control should work the same way as if the player was sitting inside as a driver.

The vehicle...

"Remote" control vehicle

item.title: Manual mover activation
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
A coder guy I know wants to make it so, that all the proximity triggered movers in Unreal (doors, etc) are triggered by a use key.

I think he can do it, but the problem is that it also opens doors that are supposed to be remotely unlocked somewhere else (and from there on behave like normal doors, or stay open).

Is there a way to limit this feature to movers that are supposed to be opened by moving close or into them, but not until it is unlocked by a trigger (or if it is only opened by a...

Manual mover activation

item.title: Passive Three-Dimensional Gaming
item.author: invalid@example.com (Drunken_Peamole)
item.dc:creator: Drunken_Peamole
item.content:encoded:
Why hasn't anyone made simple 3D rendering for these games? Can this be done by making a mod which enables multiple game cameras to render tinted transparent views of some kind? It doesn't need a special monitor! All the player needs is some red-blue goggles. I'm talking about making this for UT99, but making it for all the games would be awesome. I have just started learning Unreal script, so I don't know jack about this.
This would make playing UT even...

Passive Three-Dimensional Gaming

item.title: skins not showing for bots
item.author: invalid@example.com (Animus)
item.dc:creator: Animus
item.content:encoded:
hi guys, i have an odd issue, in unreal tournament my skin is visable in the player setup and i can select it and play with it. If i play in the game and kill myself i can see my skin so it definitifly works.

But if i choose practise session and choose configure bots i can select my skin but in the preview window i get a different skin.

I also downloaded a skin from internet and wrote the INT file exactly the same but their skin works perfect but mine not.

item.title: Custom UT2k4 campaign?
item.author: invalid@example.com (xvertigox)
item.dc:creator: xvertigox
item.content:encoded:
Hey everybody, I'm not sure if this is the right subforum to be posting in so I apologize if it's not. What I'm wanting to do is to create a custom UT2k4 campaign (with custom maps + models). I don't have experience in modding Unreal engine games but I've played around with QuakeC and I've modded+mapped a fair bit in Doom. If someone can just point me in the right direction I'd be extremely grateful.

Thanks,

item.title: Force human players to blue team
item.author: invalid@example.com (AlCapowned)
item.dc:creator: AlCapowned
item.content:encoded: I'm working on LAN tournament co-op for UT2004. One of the problems I've run in to is that, while the host goes to blue team as they should, the other player that joins goes to red team. Because this mutator uses the same game profile system that the single player tournament does, the switch team button ends up being disabled. I would like to be able to force all humans on to blue team without affecting the bots in any way, but so far I can't figure out how to do that by a mutator.

item.title: Swap Modular Pawn Components on Runtime
item.author: invalid@example.com (Pixar)
item.dc:creator: Pixar
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone,

I've successfully created a custom modular pawn and made it the player character. It's working fine, the animations from my custom animtree are working as expected, yet I'm unable to change the modular pawn's skeletal mesh components during the game.

I've searched everywhere, but so far no solution works.

My custom Player Controller class is this:

Code:
class JTPlayerController extends UTPlayerController
 config(JTGame);

exec function MudarModuloTorso()
{...
Swap Modular Pawn Components on Runtime

item.title: PhysicsAsset Hit Collision
item.author: invalid@example.com (Jeremweb)
item.dc:creator: Jeremweb
item.content:encoded:
Hello World !

Today I have a player collision probleme... Let me explain :
In order to have a good hitbox, I use the physicsAsset for collision detection. In game (dedicated server), the collision of the head is not good and I do not understand why because the rest of the body seems to be good.

Here a video that explain my problem :
(enable annotation for this video)


For the script, here is my Pawn default properties :

Code:
Begin Object...
PhysicsAsset Hit Collision
